Key Match Events: The Dodgers lost 6-3 to the Chicago Cubs at Dodger Stadium on Tuesday, with numerous defensive miscues contributing to each of the Cubs' tallies in their series-clinching win.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Dave Roberts expressed cautious optimism while discussing the state of the staff, which still is without not only Clayton Kershaw, who played catch Tuesday, but also rookie Gavin Stone, who remains shut down because of shoulder inflammation.
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Dave Roberts expressed frustration with his team's porous fielding, which was the main culprit in their fourth loss in six games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers' lineup was expected to get a boost Wednesday, with Teoscar Hern√°ndez scheduled to return after missing four games because of a foot contusion.
Others: Yoshinobu Yamamoto threw to the plate during the first inning, striking out eight batters in a dazzling four-inning, one-run return from the injured list.
Tony Gonsolin began a rehab assignment with triple-A Oklahoma City, pitching two scoreless innings in his first game action since undergoing Tommy John surgery last year.
